intro: Mimophytum chiangii, commonly known as the Chiang Mai mimophytum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It has fleshy, lobed leaves that help it store water, making it well-suited for dry conditions. Mimophytum chiangii is often found in rocky or sandy soils in its natural habitat.
